title: [QUESTION] Why is SKSurface.Create returning null? (OpenGL)
body: I'm trying to understand why surface creation is failing. I'm trying to use SkiaSharp without relying on OpenTK, or WinForms or the built-in views. surface = SKSurface.Create(grContext, renderTarget, surfaceOrigin, colorType); returns null. - but why? The OpenGL Context looks valid. I have a valid GRContext. The Width and Height are not negative (which apparently tripped up a few people). I am using the platform color type static enum reference as required. [ SKImageInfo.PlatformColorType ] Looking at the output produced in Immediate Window below, is there anything suspect to look into? colorType Bgra8888 surfaceOrigin BottomLeft renderTarget {SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTarget} Backend: OpenGL Handle: 0x00000285eeb22ca0 Height: 720 IgnorePublicDispose: false IsDisposed: false IsValid: true OwnsHandle: true Rect: {{Left=0,Top=0,Width=1280,Height=720}} SampleCount: 1 Size: {{Width=1280, Height=720}} StencilBits: 8 Width: 1280 grContext {SkiaSharp.GRContext} Backend (SkiaSharp.GRRecordingContext): OpenGL Backend: OpenGL Handle: 0x00000285f1783eb0 IgnorePublicDispose: false IsAbandoned: false IsDisposed: false OwnsHandle: true
